duties_responsibilities.duty: Install, test, and maintain high-speed fiber optic transmission equipment, circuits, and small cell networks.
Respond to network outages, impairments, and emergencies.
Perform preventative maintenance inspections and quality review tasks.
Work with fiber optic and RF test equipment and perform advanced troubleshooting.
Conduct site survey and quality review of remote locations.
Operate and manage network nodes, small cell network elements, and assigned administrative tasks.
Collaborate with cross-functional departments and peers, ensuring compliance with company policies and procedures.
Participate in on-call rotation schedule for nights, weekends, and holidays.
Follow safe work practices, integrity, and quality standards.

education_certification.credential: High School Degree or equivalent required, Associates or Technical degree strongly preferred, Wireless/Wireline Operations or equivalent military experience preferred, Valid state driver’s license with a non-negligent driving record required
